content: Home Home M a n i s h   S i n g h ProfessorDepartment of Psychology& Rutgers Center for Cognitive Science (RuCCS)Rutgers University– New Brunswick 152 Frelinghuysen Rd., Piscataway, NJ 08854 Email: <my first name> <DOT> <my last name> <AT> r u t g e r s <DOT> e d u Ph.D., 1998: Department of Cognitive Sciences, University of California, Irvine 1998 - 2001: Post-doctoral researcher, Department of Brain and Cognitive Sciences, Massachusetts Institute of Technology R e s e a r c h   I n t e r e s t s I’m a cognitive scientist interested in human perception. My work investigates various aspects of the visual perception of objects and surfaces — their perceived shape, visual completion, transparency, motion, prediction of their physical behavior, etc. It employs a combination of psychophysical studies and computational (especially probabilistic) models.
